title: The Bacchae
creator: Euripides
description:
LibriVox recording of The Bacchae by Euripides, translated by Gilbert Murray. This tragedy is based on the mythological story of King Pentheus of Thebes and his mother Agave, and their punishment by the god Dionysus (who is Pentheus' cousin) for refusing to worship him. (Summary by Wikipedia) Cast:

Dionysus: mb Cadmus: Bruce Pirie Pentheus: Algy Pug Agave: Roseanne Schmidt Teiresias: Matthew Reece Soldier: John Fricker Messenger: Dale Burgess Chorus/Narrator: Elizabeth Klett Audio edited by: Elizabeth Klett For more free audiobooks, or to become a volunteer reader, please visit LibriVox.org.

M4B format available
subject: librivox; audio; euripides; tragedy; bacchae
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text

reviews.reviewbody: It's a joy to hear this play brought to life in such a wonderful way. Many thanks to all involved in performing and producing it. Great job!
This is really delightful. Thanks for your efforts and commitment. I'm enjoying it immensely. Thanks again!
